titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James V. Duryea land deeds 1981.003
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:16:22 +0000.

did.abstract: Two deeds for land in Oyster Bay, Queens County, N.Y. The first deed, dated 1837, is from Richard H. and Edward Pearsall to James V. Duryea, and the second deed, dated 1877, is from Duryea and his wife, Jane, to Phebe Amelia Van Cott.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); James V. Duryea land deeds, 1981.003, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1981.
